metadata.title: CVE-2023-1829 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux Kernel traffic control indexfilter (tcindex) can be exploited to achieve local privilege escalation.The tcindex_delete function which does not properly deactivate filters incase of a perfect hashes while deleting the underlying structure which canlater lead to double freeing the structure. A local attacker user can usethis vulnerability to elevate its privileges to root. We recommendupgrading past commit 8c710f75256bb3cf05ac7b1672c82b92c43f3d28.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1829` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-240-generic - 4.4.0-240.274
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-240-generic - 4.4.0-240.274
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-240-lowlatency - 4.4.0-240.274
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-210-generic - 4.15.0-210.221~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-210-generic - 4.15.0-210.221~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-210-lowlatency - 4.15.0-210.221~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1119-kvm - 4.4.0-1119.129
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1156-aws - 4.4.0-1156.171
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1155-aws - 4.15.0-1155.168~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1164-azure - 4.15.0-1164.179~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1149-gcp - 4.15.0-1149.165~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1118-oracle - 4.15.0-1118.129~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-240.274').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-210.221~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1119.129').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1156.171').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1155.168~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1164.179~16.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips/xenial is affected and needs fixing.
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1149.165~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1118.129~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
